column4: ï»¿hi, im not sure im in the right chat, but ill just ask:  Is it possible to link 2 pc over sata II ?
It's possible, yes... but I haven't heard of anyone doing it
can you give more details or a hint to a discussion / howto?
it's possible in the same way as building a 200 meter long car out of tooth picks...
I have no idea how one would do it.. but I guess it would take at least a couple of months to build the hardware and write some kind of driver for it..
then it seems you know more about sata and how it communicates than I do
what makes you think someone has done it? it seems easier to just use a regular ethernet connection
if gigabig lan it too slow you're no longer playing in the "low budget" division =).. not sure what they use in supercomputers.. probably something special
but go read up on the protocol SATA uses.. if you're lucky it's just software you need
hmm.. system corruption? I would do a complete reinstall
i had this issues before after a reboot they were fixed
you might be able to fix the problems you can spot easily but there might be other things crashing and running amok where you can't see them..
oh.. well.. a reboot is a pretty easy thing to try.. but I would look into what might be causing the problems.. could be bad memory or something
there is a memtest option in the grub menu .. run that for a day or so
it's best to run it from a live cd or from the grub menu..
there are some memory checkers you can run while the system is running too.. but you won't be able to check all your memory that way
